greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime q such that (q^p-1)/(q-1) is prime, where p = prime(n); or 0 if no such prime q exists.
comment: Corresponding primes (q^p-1)/(q-1) are listed in A123488.
a(n) coincides with A066180(n) when A066180(n) is prime or 0.
Conjecture: Never is a(n) equal to 0.
First occurrence of the k_th prime: 1, 20, 5, 32, 21, 33, 81, 17, ... ;
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..205
mathematica: f[n_] := NestWhile[NextPrime, 2, ! PrimeQ[Cyclotomic[Prime[n], #]] &]; Array[f, 63](* _Davin Park_, Dec 28 2016 and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 28 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(x = 2); while (!isprime(polcyclo(prime(n), x)), x= nextprime(x+1)); x;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 10 2016
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Sep 30 2006, Oct 02 2006
